required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cemented TrendHip® - Multicenter PMCF Study on Total Indications
clinical_study.official_title: Post Market Clinical Follow-Up (PMCF) Study to Evaluate the Performance and Safety of the Cemented TrendHip® Stem in a Prospective Follow-up Study

brief_summary.textblock: This Post Market Clinical Follow-Up (PMCF) study to evaluate the performance and safety of the cemented TrendHip® stem in a prospective follow-up study with patients who underwent a hip arthroplasty with the investigational product (representative of usual clinical practice), at two follow-up examinations

primary_outcome.measure: Change of functional outcome over five year follow-up period (Harris Hip Score)
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative (as available) and at two examinations during Follow-Up (1 year postop, 5 years postop)
primary_outcome.description: The Harris Hip Score (HHS) is one of the most used scores in total hip arthroplasty, mainly combining range of motion questions with questions regarding daily life activities.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at two examinations during Follow-Up (1 year postop, 5 years postop)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain will be measured with a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS), at rest and when walking on flat ground. The Visual Analog Scale (VAS) is a 10 cm line with anchor statements on the left (no pain) and on the right (extreme pain). The patients are asked to mark their current pain level on the line.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at two examinations during Follow-Up (1 year postop, 5 years postop)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient is asked for satisfaction with surgery result with a 4-point scale: very satisfied, satisfied, unsatisfied, very unsatisfied

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at two examinations during Follow-Up (1 year postop, 5 years postop)
secondary_outcome.description: The survival of the TrendHip® Total Hip Prothesis will be analyzed using the "Kaplan-Meier".

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological Outcome: Migration of the stem in mm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at two examinations during Follow-Up (1 year postop, 5 years postop)
secondary_outcome.description: Migration of the stem is assessed in [mm] relative to postoperative x-rays

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological Outcome: Evaluation of bony osseointegration or conspicuous features of the stem
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at two examinations during Follow-Up (1 year postop, 5 years postop)
secondary_outcome.description: Bony Osseointegration or conspicuous features of the stem are assessed on anterior-posterior and lateral x-rays of the stem and will be analysed according to the zones defined by Gruen. "Charnley" and "Gruen" zones of the hip are distinct zones used in assessment of aseptic loosening in total hip joint replacements

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at two examinations during Follow-Up (1 year postop, 5 years postop)
secondary_outcome.description: Brooker classification divides heterotopic ossifications that form following total hip replacement to four classes. Class I: islands of bone within soft tissues around hip; Class II: bone spurs in pelvis or proximal end of femur leaving ≥1 cm between the opposing bone surfaces; Class III: bone spurs that extend from pelvis or the proximal end of femur, which reduce the space between the opposing bone surfaces to <1cm; Class IV: ankylosis of the hip on x-ray

other_outcome.measure: Rate of Adverse and Serious Adverse Events
other_outcome.time_frame: at two examinations during Follow-Up (1 year postop, 5 years postop)
other_outcome.description: All Adverse Events (AE) / Serious Adverse Events (SAE) observed during the follow-up examination or reported by the patient will be documented. Only those AE and SAE that could be related to the investigational product or the TrendHip® Total Hip Arthroplasty procedure are of interest.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion: Inclusion criteria
- Patient older than 18 years.
- Patient who undergo / underwent a hip arthroplasty with cemented TrendHip® femoral stem according to the indications for implantation specified in the Instructions for Use.
- Patient not opposing participation in the study.
Exclusion: Exclusion criteria
- Patient with shortened life expectancy.
- The patient is unable to commit to the planned follow-up period.
